WBHHMQS	1415	MARQUIS FLY REEL	<p>Since we stopped making the Marquis we have been inundated by requests for its reinstatement. So that's what we've done. This is a new Marquis salmon reel in sizes one, two and three, built to the original design. We've made the new reels and spools interchangeable with all the originals because we know exactly what happens. Over the years, a frame gets dropped, buckled or broken. You still have the spools and the lines that you love but without a new reel frame, they're useless. Not now. You're back in business. The new reels are all manufactured from high-grade aluminium with the polished silver rim style that everyone agrees is the Marquis at its best. This isn't quite the original Marquis though. Because we can't resist improving things we've slightly redesigned the internal cam to give an increased range to the click-check.</p><ul><li>Frame and spools fully interchangeable with the originals</li><li>All-aluminium frame for strength</li><li>Polished silver rim for classic look</li><li>In three sizes to cover every salmon fishing situation</li></ul>               <table WBHHPFTS	1417	PERFECT SALMON FLY REEL	Many years have passed since Foster worked on his ‘apprentice' poweredtreadle lathe to produce the first ‘Perfect' reel, and countless reelsof different designs have been sold by numerous fishing tacklecompanies, but none have stood the test of time like the Hardy Perfect.<p /><p>AlthoughFoster's original design has undergone several design updates in thelast 121 years, the sound principal which Foster originally patented inDecember 1888 still remains in the Salmon Perfect we are manufacturingin our Alnwick Factory today.</p><p>The 2010 salmon Perfect takes thebest features from the various designs over the years - check mechanismand dimensions from the 1921 Perfect, the 1972 reel back and a platedesign which echoes that of 1912 Perfect. Combine these with BarstockAluminium construction, 18 stainless steel ball bearing race, ivorinetype handle and revolving line guard, and the fact that the Perfectreel design has been undergoing field testing since 1921 (dup. MkIIversion) and Charlie Norris, the Hardy Reel Designer, believes thePerfect we are launching for 2010 is possibly the best Hardy Perfectsalmon reel hardy has ever made.</p><ul><li>Reel diameter - 4&quot; and 41/4&quot;</li></ul><ul><li>Spool width - 1 11/32&quot;</li></ul><ul><li>Revolving line guide</li></ul><ul><li>18 steel ball bearing race</li></ul><br /><table width="550" cellspacing="1" WBHHUNQ	1422	UNIQUA FLY REEL	<p>The offset drag system issensitive, reliable and quickly adjustable. The reel can be easilychanged from left to right hand wind and the deep spools take a greatdeal of backing in even the smaller sizes. The Uniqua is cageless inits smaller sizes so these can be palmed when the fish is running. Onthe larger reels, we have added a cage for the extra strength you needfor big fish. These bigger reels have been designed to take modernlonger bellied lines along with a couple of hundred yards of backing.The reels are designed to marry perfectly with the Uniqua rods andproduce a complete rod/reel combination for every angling challenge.</p><ul><li>A beautifully constructed reel from high-grade, durable aluminium</li></ul><ul><li>Highly sensitive, easily adjustable offset drag system</li><li>Legendary strength and deep spool capacity make this the ideal big fish reel</li><li>Designed to complement the Uniqua rod range</li></ul><br /><table width="550" cellspacing="1" WBHHBVI	1409	BOUGLE MKVI FLY REEL	The strength of the Bougle - apart from its looks - lies in its ability to protect tippets. The design is derived from the historic Hardy Perfect: the Bougle runs on ball-bearings which make it one of the smoothest winding reels ever constructed. The ventilated spool and the aluminium spindle both contribute to lightness and strength. The Bougle is characterised by the clear anodised aluminium finish and the striking ivorine handle. And of course by the sing-song notes of a fish taking line.<ul><li>Ventilated spool</li></ul><ul><li>Aluminium spindle for smoothness, strength and durability</li></ul><ul><li>Clear, anodised WBORZG	906	ZERO GRAVITY FLY ROD DISCONTINUED	<table width="98%" cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" border="0"><tbody><tr><th scope="col"><p class="style2">Brand New Never Opened Includes Warranty Card!!!</p></th></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td><div align="center"><img src="http://www.westbranchangler.com/images/ebay/Orvis_ZG/orvis_shot_zg.jpg" style="width: 427px; height: 331px;" /></div></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td>Fly rod features: This superior fly rod will launch your performance <ul><li>More feedback makes casting &amp; presentation easier</li><li>25% more durable to protect your investment</li><li>Fly rod is handcrafted from start to finish</li></ul><p>Fly rod details:</p><ul><li>Our fly rod blank features boron, a pure carbon scrim system and thermoplastic-toughened resin.</li><li>A new system of fully finished ferrules results in seamless joints that are strengthened to prevent cracking and checking</li><li>Three coats of finish with a final UV blocking coat</li><li>Protective aluminum fly rod tube</li><li>Nickel silverÃƒÆ’Ã‚Â¢â‚¬ÃƒÂ¢â‚¬Ã¯Â¿Â½anodized aluminum hardware with tiger maple insert. Hard chrome guides. Silicon carbide stripping guide. <br /></li></ul><div align="center"><img width="508" height="279" align="middle" alt="http://www.westbranchangler.com" src="http://www.westbranchangler.com/images/ebay/Orvis_ZG/flex3.JPG" /></div></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td><div align="center"><span style="font-weight: bold;">What Makes The Zero Gravity So Special? </span><br /><br /><br /></div></td></tr><tr><td><p><img width="200" height="190" align="left" alt="Orvis Zero Gravity" src="http://www.westbranchangler.com/images/ebay/Orvis_ZG/zg_helicopter.jpg" />Zero Gravity fly rods use the same composite system thaafter five years the US Army found made a dramatic difference in Apache helicopter blades.Zero G Fly Rods: Using the same technology as Blackhawk II Helicoper blades You might think its a stretch between rotor blades and fly rods, but they both require similar properties. Helicopter blades undergo constant turbulence, far more than an airplane wings, yet they must be light, strong, and flexible. Not too far from what a fly rod has to put up with during a blitz of tuna. The US Army found that by making Apache blades from graphite composites with thermoplastic-enriched thermoset resins, the blades could produce a larger airfoil, rotate at higher speeds, and carry a bigger payload at the same time making it four times stronger!<br /><img width="200" height="114" align="right" alt="Orvis Zero Gravity" src="http://www.westbranchangler.com/images/ebay/Orvis_ZG/f-22.jpg" /></p><p>These composites are also used in the V-22 Osprey, C-17 transport planes, the F-22 fighterScientist who helped formuate the Zero G Fly Rod, the Joint Strike Fighter, and the top-secret UCAV (Unmanned Combat Aerial Vehicle). Our exclusive consultant on fly rod materials is a composite scientist with top security clearance. The new Zero G fly rods are a result of his research with the military and our testing of fly rods using this technology in the field.<br />What makes them so special?</p><p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Thermoplastic Resins</span></p><p>Only three fly rod series in the world exist that use high-cure thermoplastic enriched thermoset resins: Orvis Zero Gravity, Orvis T-3, and Orvis TLS Power Matrix. Our exclusive resins are set at a high cure temperature, and completely encase the graphite fibers used as the main source of power, distance, and accuracy in a fly rod. In contrast to the standard epoxy resins found in all other fly rods, thermoplastics make a fly rod stronger, tougher, and more accurate.</p><p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Boron Fibers in our Strategic Positioning System</span></p><p>Boron is a stiff, strong, and very expensive fiber. Alone, its too stiff to make a fly rod by conventional means. But, when we add just the right amount of boron into the butt section of a rod it produces a reserve power, because boron compresses less under stress. This power takes over in your longest casts or when playing big fish with maximum stress on the rod. Plus, our new Strategic Positioning System, developed specifically for Zero Gravity rods, allows us to place the boron fibers in precisely the right spot and in just the right amount for each individual rod taper.</p><p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Unidirectional Carbon Scrim</span></p><p><img width="200" height="102" align="left" alt="Orvis Zero Gravity" src="http://www.westbranchangler.com/images/ebay/Orvis_ZG/wrap.jpg" />Did you know fiberglass is used in most all other graphite rods?The Latest in Scrim Technology Graphite and resins by themselves dont offer enough strength to withstand normal fishing conditions. So, a supportive layer of fiberglass is attached to the graphite fibers before theyre wrapped around a steel mandrel to form the taper. Its worked well for 30 years, but it adds weight to a rod. Our Zero G rods use the latest in scrim technology: Unidirectional graphite scrim, which is lighter, stronger, and more dependable than fiberglass scrim. Because this material, part of our Strategic Positioning System, is so strong we only need to use a fraction of the graphite, as compared to the fiberglass used in other rods. The result is a much thinner rod yet even stronger fly rod.</p><p>Some other rod manufacturers claim to use graphite scrim in their rods, but many use a mat of graphite fibers, which doesnt offer the strength and superior fiber alignment (and thus better rod tracking you get by using unidirectional graphite scrim.</p><p><span style="font-weight: bold;">The Bottom Line:</span></p><p>Zero G rod blanks are 25% stronger yet 25% thinner than comparable blanks, and 40% lighter.<br />If youre totally satisfied with your casting, have no worries about your rod breaking on the trip of a lifetime, and can put the fly exactly where you want it every time, you probably dont need a Zero G. But, if youre not always happy with your casting, the Zero G technology is the best reason you will ever have to upgrade.</p></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr><tr><td><div align="center" class="style3"></div><br /></td></tr><tr><td><div align="center" class="style3">Questions? Call Us 800.201.2557 </div></td></tr><tr><td>&nbsp;</td></tr></tbody></table>			ZGfresh06_lg.jpg						655.00		395.00	Discontinued		Fly Rods	OR	discontinued		3	Matrix_Reloaded				1	0	http://www.westbranchangler.com/assetstore/site/images/items/120x120/	http://www.westbranchangler.com/assetstore/site/images/items/325x325/	http://www.westbranchangler.com/					flypage_show_stock.html	0	0	0	0	0

MX stands for maximum, as in maximum power, distance and fish fighting capabilities. The 5 and 6-weights are slightly stiffer and faster than their Boron IIx counterparts; the 7 through 12-weights are true gun that can handle sinking lines, big flies and adverse wind conditions. While all seven models feature faster actions and are capable of making long distance, 100+ foot casts, they will amaze you with their responsiveness and light weight. The rods come with a cork fighting butt and our new double locking reel seat. WBWRBIIx	908	BORON-IIX (BIIX) SINGLE HANDED FLY RODS	<span style="font-weight: bold; color: rgb(0, 153, 0);">Boron IIx Rods<br /></span><br />A common flaw in most fast-action designs is a lack of casting range; the rods are often hard to load at short distances and even at longer range can be clumsy due to overly stiff butt sections. The Boron IIx series has changed everything. These are responsive, powerful, highly accurate fly rods that perform across a wide casting range; they load easily for gentle presentations up close, yet can also make very long, pinpoint casts of 100 feet. To date, across the board, Boron IIx rods (as well as Boron IIt rods) are the lightest in the industry. This makes for very pleasant, all-day casting, even with the 10 and 12-weights. WBROCLA	948	CLA REELS/SPOOLS	<table style="background-color: rgb(220, 220, 220);" align="center" border="0" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="1" width="90%"><tbody><tr><td colspan="2" class="reelschartsrowthree"><p>TheCLA has set a new standard for affordable, hybrid large arbor flyreels. This series incorporates a superior drag mechanism that isextraordinarily smooth, heat resistant and provides incredible stoppingpower. While the CLA is offered at a reasonable price, no designfeatures have been overlooked. Each reel in this series is designedwith a specific diameter and width to maximize the properties of dragconsistency and quick line retrieval. The CLA has become our dealers'"go to" reel for anglers that are looking for an American made, highquality, reasonably priced fly reel.</p> <p><span style="font-weight: bold;">CLA 4-7 (Larger Components for Bigger Fish!)</span><br>Themechanical design of all CLA reels is consistent throughout the series,but improvements have been made to the four largest sizes (4-7) tosupport their use in battling bigger fish. When comparing the largerCLA reels to the smaller sized 1, 1.5, 2 and 3 reels, you will findthat they have a larger sized drag knob, handle and spool cap, but mostimportantly, they have a STRONGER DRAG SYSTEM. To ensure smoothperformance with fast-running fish, the four larger sized CLA reelshave also been equipped with oil-impregnated bushings for improvedspool rotation. The frame and spool have been reinforced to eliminateflexing when battling heavyweights. With a wide range of sizesavailable, the CLA series is appropriate for any fishing application,including Spey.</p> </td>  </tr>  <tr>    <td class="reelschartsrowone"><span style="font-weight: bold;">Frame/Spool Material:</span></td>    <td class="reelschartsrowtwo">6061-T6 proprietary aluminum alloy</td>  </tr>    <tr>    <td class="reelschartsrowtwo"><span style="font-weight: bold;">Manufacturing Specifications:</span></td>    <td class="reelschartsrowone">Fully machined, 1 piece frame, 1 piece spool with a Delrin pressed hub - manufactured on automated CNC machining centers</td>  </tr>    <tr>    <td class="reelschartsrowone"><span style="font-weight: bold;">Drag Material:</span></td>    <td class="reelschartsrowtwo">Delrin 500AF with impregnated Teflon - space-age polymer that is durable, heat resistant, self lubricating and maintenance free</td>  </tr>    <tr>    <td class="reelschartsrowtwo"><span style="font-weight: bold;">Drag Mechanism:</span></td>    <td class="reelschartsrowone">Delrin 500AF to anodized aluminum interface - push frame friction disc drag system</td>  </tr>    <tr>    <td class="reelschartsrowone"><span style="font-weight: bold;">Drag Engagement System:</span></td>    <td class="reelschartsrowtwo">Redundancy radial pawl engagement</td>  </tr>    <tr>    <td class="reelschartsrowtwo"><span style="font-weight: bold;">Spool Rotation Mechanism:</span></td>    <td class="reelschartsrowone">Delrinhub rotating on a stainless steel spindle, oil impregnated bronzebushings rotating on a stainless steel spindle (Sizes 4-7)</td>  </tr>    <tr>    <td class="reelschartsrowone"><span style="font-weight: bold;">Number of Reels in Series:</span></td>    <td class="reelschartsrowtwo">Eight</td>  </tr>    <tr>    <td class="reelschartsrowtwo"><span style="font-weight: bold;">Fly Rod Coverage:</span></td>    <td class="reelschartsrowone">2 wt. - 13 wt. WBROEVO	950	EVOLUTION REEL & SPOOLS	<table cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center" width="90%" style="background-color: rgb(220, 220, 220);"><tbody><tr><td class="reelschartsrowthree" colspan="2"><p>TheEvolution is a high end hybrid large arbor fly reel that is a machiningmasterpiece. The first time you pick up the Evolution you will knowright away that this reel defines perfection in every way. This serieswas designed for those anglers who equally appreciate art and function.The cosmetic innovation and precision workmanship of the Evolutionseries is only surpassed by its drag system which is precise andsensitive - capable of protecting the lightest tippets even whenbattling world-class fish. To guarantee the level of dependabilityconsumers have come to expect from all Ross products, we have designeda drag system for the Evolution series that has triple redundancy;providing for three backup drag systems and thereby guaranteeingdependability under the most demanding fishing conditions. The spokedesigned frame and extensive spool ventilation make this seriesincredibly lightweight, yet the Evolution is built to endure a lifetimeof flawless performance. Each reel in this series is designed with aspecific diameter and width to maximize the properties of dragconsistency and quick line retrieval. The Evolution series is truly artin motion, and will satisfy the demands of the most discriminatingangler.</p> </td>    </tr>  <tr>    <td class="reelschartsrowone"><span style="font-weight: WBROMTM	951	MOMENTUM FLY REEL/SPOOL	<table style="background-color: rgb(220, 220, 220);" align="center" border="0" cellpadding="3" cellspacing="1" width="90%"><tbody><tr><td colspan="2" class="reelschartsrowthree"><p><span style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic;"><span style="color: black;">Mo men tum: (mO-'men-tm) (n. pl.)</span> - A measure of the motion of a body equal to the product of its mass and velocity.</span></p> <p><span style="font-weight: bold; font-style: italic;"><span style="color: black;">Synonyms:</span> drive, energy, power, strength</span></p>   <p>TheMomentum reel series has proven to be the strongest and most dependablesaltwater fly reel on the water today, and is a perfect example of howto maximize the benefits of carbon fiber technology in a drag system.Stiffness, strength, heat resistance, shock-dampening capabilities andinfinite fatigue resistance are all properties of carbon fiber thathelp make the Momentum drag system the strongest and most dependablebig game reel available. We have partnered with Kestrel Bike Company inthe development of the Momentum's carbon fiber drag system. Our vastexperience in fly reel design and manufacturing is equally matched byKestrel's expertise in the design and production of carbon fibercomponents. Kestrel has been manufacturing the world's finest carbonfiber bikes since 1987. In fact, Kestrel designed and produced the veryfirst all-carbon bike frame. They are pioneers in the carbon fiberindustry and we were thrilled that a company of their caliber agreed tojoin us in the development of this new drag technology. When it comesto engineering, development and production of carbon fiber products,Kestrel has written the book and their expertise with carbon fiber issimply unmatched.</p> <p>Welcome to the next generation of Rossproducts! The Momentum series represents a cosmic departure fromcurrent Ross designs in both function and style. The carbon fiber wehave employed for the Momentum drag system is incredibly strong! Themeasurement of the strength for this material is "ksi", which denotestensile strength in thousands of pounds per square inch. So just howstrong is our carbon fiber drag system? To get a good perspective onthis, the aluminum used to produce Ross products is 45ksi; meaning itcan resist a tension load of 45,000 pounds per square inch of material.This is pretty impressive until you realize that the carbon fiber usedin the Momentum drag system is 700ksi - vastly stronger than aluminum,steel and even titanium!</p> <p>The first time you handle a Momentumreel, you will be amazed with its meticulous machining and ergonomicdesign. We have custom fit this series with a large, well positioneddrag knob - easily found for adjustment during the heat of battle, butnever in the way. Additionally, the Momentum's handle has been designedto fit comfortably between your fingers, but will never slip free whentaking on a monster fish. Each reel in this series is designed with aspecific diameter and width to maximize the properties of dragconsistency and quick line retrieval. With 6.3 square inches ofeffective drag surface, and 12 pounds of dead lift weight, the Momentumseries has three times the effective stopping power of every dragtested. Put simply, the Momentum is the strongest fly fishing reel onthe market today; and it costs considerably less than many competitivebrands. A triple redundancy drag system ensures dependability under themost demanding fishing conditions, and by adding in features liketitanium drag components, a quick-release locking spool and watershedding grooves on the palming rim, you have the ultimate big game flyreel. With a wide range of sizes available, the Momentum series isappropriate for any fishing application, including Spey.</p> </td>  </tr>  <tr>    <td class="reelschartsrowone"><span style="font-weight: bold;">Frame/Spool Material:</span></td>    <td class="reelschartsrowtwo">6061-T6 proprietary aluminum alloy</td>  </tr>    <tr>    <td class="reelschartsrowtwo"><span style="font-weight: bold;">Manufacturing Specifications:</span></td>    <td class="reelschartsrowone">Fully machined, 1 piece frame, 1 piece spool - manufactured on automated CNC machining centers</td>  </tr>    <tr>    <td class="reelschartsrowone"><span style="font-weight: bold;">Drag Material:</span></td>    <td class="reelschartsrowtwo">Carbon fiber and Rulon - space-age synthetics that are durable, heat resistant, self lubricating and maintenance free</td>  </tr>    <tr>    <td class="reelschartsrowtwo"><span style="font-weight: bold;">Drag WBRWFLYS	952	FLYSTART REELS/SPOOLS	0<p>The Flystart is a hybrid large arbor fly reel that is inexpensive, yet built with the same commitment to quality and performance as all Ross reels. The drag system is designed to be smooth, consistent and have a wide range of adjustment. Fly fishing is a sport that everyone can enjoy, but for many people, the price of fly tackle is often a barrier to participation. The Ross team was committed to producing an introductory priced fly reel that would perform to the expectations of even the most experienced angler, and the Flystart series perfectly meets this goal. You will be amazed with its quality in manufacturing tolerance, drag performance and sound. The Flystart is a great reel for first-time fly fishing participants that demand quality, but do not want to spend a fortune gearing up to fish.</p><p><span style="font-weight: bold;">The Flystart series come with the following standard features:</span><br /></p><ul><li>Manufactured out of high quality aluminum</li><li>Self-lubricating, synthetic drag system that is virtually maintenance free</li><li>Electrostatically coated for the perfect balance of hardness and color</li><li>Seamless transition between line-in and drag engagement (no start-up friction)</li><li>Quick release locking spool</li><li>Easy left-hand to right-hand retrieve conversion</li><li>Exposed spool rim for palming</li></ul><div class="leftpara"><p><span style="font-weight: bold;">FRAME/SPOOL MATERIAL</span> High quality aluminum alloy</p><p><span style="font-weight: bold;">MANUFACTURING SPECIFICATIONS</span> Gravity fed - cast aluminum, 1 piece frame, 2 piece assembled spool, machine finished</p><p><span style="font-weight: bold;">DRAG MATERIAL</span> 500P ÃƒÆ’Ã¯Â¿Â½ space-age polymer that is durable, heat resistant, self-lubricating and maintenance free</p><p><span style="font-weight: bold;">DRAG ENGAGEMENT SYSTEM</span> Delrin 500P interface ÃƒÆ’Ã¯Â¿Â½ offset gear-to-gear disc drag engagement</p><p><span style="font-weight: bold;">ESCAPEMENT SYSTEM</span> Pawl engagement</p><p><span style="font-weight: bold;">SPOOL ROTATION MECHANISM</span> Oil impregnated bronze bushings rotating on a stainless steel spindle</p><p><span style="font-weight: bold;">FINISH</span> Corrosion resistant electrostatic coating</p><p><span style="font-weight: bold;">NUMBER OF REELS IN SERIES</span> 4</p><p><span style="font-weight: bold;">FLY ROD COVERAGE</span> 3wt. - 8wt.</p><p><span style="font-weight: bold;">FISHING APPLICATION</span> Designed for use in all freshwater and saltwater fishing environments</p></div><table cellspacing="1" cellpadding="3" border="0" align="center" style="width: 550px; WBHHHRZS	1063	ZANE FLY RODS	<h2 class="style1"><span style="font-size: 10pt;">ZANE FLY ROD SERIES</span></h2>  <p>Hardy has a rich traditionof building innovative tackle for saltwater fishing and eighty yearsago Zane Grey, the famous American author, angler and traveler was afriend of the company. We designed much of his tackle for many of hisexploratory angling trips around the seas of the world. After a greatdeal of testing and even more feedback, we are convinced that the newZane range of saltwater fly rods is going to prove a worthy tribute toone of anglingÃ¢â‚¬â„¢s great pioneers.</p>  <p>The key to the Zane rods arethe blanks, amongst the slimmest ever produced, capable of cuttingthrough coastal winds like a knife. A careful blend of multi-modulusfibers allows easy loading but very fast recovery Ã¢â‚¬â€œ the perfectcombination for quick accurate casting over any range.</p>  <p>On thebutt section are two Fuji-lines SIC rings, one of 20mm and one of 16mm.These are designed to allow super-rapid line clearance and to funnelthe line for that last powerful shoot.</p>  <p>The reel seat ishard-anodized aluminum, picked out in blue, to mirror the color of theblanks and to match the trim of the Zane reels. The double lockingscrews clamp the reel to the rod Ã¢â‚¬â€œ but the fitted nylon washers mean itwonÃ¢â‚¬â„¢t be stuck there at the end of the day!</p>  <p>Zane rods aredesigned for saltwater fishing but are also ideal for other specieslike salmon, sea-trout, steelhead and even pike.</p>  <p>The finepoints of the Zane package include carved aluminum stoppers, a glassreinforced carbon tube in translucent blue, and elegantly etched roddetails. The Zane is supplied in a protective neoprene carrying system.</p>  <p>All the rods are 9Ã¢â‚¬â„¢ in length.</p>  <ul><li>The #7 is a light bonefish rod for those calm days when presentation isparamount. It is also ideal for sea trout and sea bass in northernEurope.</li><li>The #8 is the mainstay bonefish rod, an all around saltwater classic.</li><li>The #9 is perfect for smaller permit and the biggest bonefish.</li><li>The #10 is the permit rod par-excellence and ideal for medium tarpon.</li><li>The #12 is the ideal rod for handling tarpon, shark and other blue water species.</li></ul> WBHHHRKE	1070	GLADSTONE BAMBOO FLY RODS	  <h1 class="style1">GLADSTONE (SPLIT BAMBOO)  </h1>  <p><span class="col">Namedin tribute to Callum Gladstone, our master-builder of split-bamboo flyrods, the first thing that you will notice about this new rod is itsspectacular appearance. Prior to the building process, the finestTonkin bamboo is hand-flamed, resulting in a rich, dark browntortoiseshell finish.<br>      <br> This two-piece rod series isavailable in three sizes, each with its own individual taper thatcelebrates the achievements of some of the greatest American split-canerod builders of the past: the Leonard family, Everett Garrison andEdward Payne. Minute adjustments are made to the Hardy precisionplanning form, to painstakingly recreate a modern version of theseclassic tapers. The perfect angle and taper on each spline means thatthe finished rod forms a perfect hexagon. Each rod shares in common theÃ¢â‚¬Ëœswelled buttÃ¢â‚¬â„¢ that contributes considerable backbone to the feel,allowing a deep action to be combined with excellent dampeningcharacteristics.</span> WBBRROUGE	1072	BAUER ROGUE REEL/SPOOL	 <table width="564" border="0" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" height="56"><tbody><tr><td valign="top" width="564" bgcolor="#e1caa5"><div style="margin: 10px 30px 20px 20px;"><img src="http://www.bauerflyreel.com/Images/rogue.jpg" alt="" style="margin-left: 30px; margin-top: 20px; margin-bottom: 30px;" width="250" align="right" border="0" height="162"><span style="font-weight: bold;" class="heading">Rogue</span><br><br>With over a decade of leadership and innovation in large arbor fly reel design, Bauer proudly introduces the Rogue series. The all new series features a Carbon Fiber Composite disc drag system and V-Arbor design. The patented, seamless engagement drag is sealed, however is serviceable if required. The Rogue uses four sealed precision stainless steel ball bearings, with no plastic parts or bushings. <br><br>The distinctive V-Arbor design maintains a larger effective diameter for the portion of the fly line and backing that is actually used when fishing. The balance of the backing is stored in the V bottom of the arbor, always available when needed. <br><br>The Rogue has a Stealth Black polished finish with optional spool colors. It is also available in striking all Splash frame and spool options. WBWRBIIxD	1074	BORON-IIX (BIIX) DOUBLE HANDED SPEY RODS	<span style="font-weight: bold; color: rgb(0, 153, 0);">Boron IIx Double Handed Spey Rods<br /><br /></span><span style="color: rgb(0, 0, 0);">Boron IIx two-handed spey rods, made with our second-generation boron/graphite composite, are the lightest spey rods in the world and offer extraordinary power, responsiveness and accuracy.<br /><br /></span>A common flaw in most fast-action designs is a lack of casting range;the rods are often hard to load at short distances and even at longerrange can be clumsy due to overly stiff butt sections. The Boron IIxseries has changed everything. These are responsive, powerful, highlyaccurate fly rods that perform across a wide casting range; they loadeasily for gentle presentations up close, yet can also make very long,pinpoint casts of 100 feet. To date, across the board, Boron IIx rods(as well as Boron IIt rods) are the lightest in the industry. Thismakes for very pleasant, all-day casting, even with the 10 and12-weights. We urge you to cast a Boron IIx today. You will be amazed.<br /><br /><table width="489" cellspacing="1" cellpadding="0" border="0" bgcolor="#000000" align="center"><tbody><tr><th width="109" bgcolor="#dfdfdf" scope="col">Line The Gunnison was introduced in the 1980’s, remained in our product line for more than fifteen years and was considered to be the most durable fly reel ever produced- until now! The Rhythm drag system is precise and sensitive, and capable of protecting the lightest tippets even when battling world-class fish. It is lightweight, yet built sturdy enough to take the abuse of heavy angling. Each reel in this series is designed with a specific diameter and width to maximize the properties of drag consistency and quick line retrieval.  The Rhythm series is perfect for those anglers who are equally concerned about impeccable drag performance, aesthetics and rugged durability.  And when you consider that our original Gunnison series was honored with more industry awards than any other fly reel in the world, it becomes clear that the Rhythm’s success in taking Gunnison’s place in the market is no small accomplishment.		ross_rhythm_flyreel.jpg						210.00		147.00	 Equipment		Reels	RO	Discontinued			Matrix_Reloaded				0	0	http://www.westbranchangler.com/assetstore/site/images/items/120x120/	http://www.westbranchangler.com/site/images/items/325x325/    	http://www.westbranchangler.com/					flypage.html	0	0	0	0
